intro: Alsinella alpestris, commonly known as the alpine alsinella, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels. It thrives in alpine meadows and rocky soils, often at high altitudes. Alsinella alpestris is adapted to cold climates and is often found in areas with poor soil conditions.
